Package com.github.tnakamot.json.parser

Class JSONParserException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • com.github.tnakamot.json.parser.JSONParserException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class JSONParserException
extends Exception
    Thrown when a JSON lexical analyzer fails to tokenize a given JSON text due to a syntax error.

    Instances of this class are immutable.

    The error message can be customized by JSONParserErrorMessageFormat. The message format is basically 

     (name):(position): (message)

    (name) is the file name of the source JSON text. If JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showFullPath() is true, the full path or URL is shown.

    (position) shows the location where the error is detected within the source JSON text. If JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showLineAndColumnNumber() is false, the position in number of Unicode characters is shown (starting from zero). If it is true, the line number and the column (both starting from one) separated by ":" is shown.

    If JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showErrorLine() is true, a line which contains the error is shown additionally with a position marker.

    Here is an example of a JSON text which has an error: 

     {
   "key": My name is JSON
 }

    If

    • JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showFullPath() is false
    • JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showLineAndColumnNumber() is true
    • JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showErrorLine() is false

    the error message from the parser will be 

     hello.json:12: unknown token starting with 'M'

    If

    • JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showFullPath() is true
    • JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showLineAndColumnNumber() is false
    • JSONParserErrorMessageFormat.showErrorLine() is true

    the error message from the parser will be 

     /path/to/hello.json:12: unknown token starting with 'M'
 "key": My name is JSON
        ^
    See Also:
